results: Proves #P-hardness of computing matrix immanants for a broad class of shapes and restricted sets of matrices
title: #P-hardness proofs of matrix immanants evaluated on restricted matrices
abstract: \#P-hardness of computing matrix immanants are proved for each member of a broad class of shapes and restricted sets of matrices. We prove \#P-hardness of computing $\lambda$-immanants of $0$-$1$ matrices when $\lambda$ has a large domino-tilable part and satisfying some technical conditions. We also give hardness proofs of some $\lambda$-immanants of weighted adjacency matrices of planarly drawable directed graphs, such that the shape $\lambda = (\mathbf{1}+\lambda_d)$ has size $n$ such that $|\lambda_d| = n^{\varepsilon}$ for some $0<\varepsilon<\frac{1}{2}$, and for some $w$, the shape $\lambda_d/(w)$ is tilable with $1\times 2$ dominos.
